setupTax.title: The Setup Tax: 3-5 Days Lost Before Day One
setupTax.description: Every new project starts with debt: days of configuration, dependency management, and repetitive code before the first line of real value is written.

technicalDebtTax.title: The Hidden Debt Tax: 42% of Your Time
technicalDebtTax.description: is lost in maintenance and debugging because of poor initial architectural choices, crippling future innovation.

aiSupervisionTax.title: The AI Supervision Tax: +26% Longer Reviews
aiSupervisionTax.description: Current AI assistants promise speed but deliver complexity. Code review time increases by 26% because your developers have to spend their time supervising the machine.

subtitle.line1: You're Paying a Tax on Innovation.

solution.title: The Architech CLI eliminates the setup tax
solution.description: By providing a standardized, high-quality foundation that scales with your vision.

chart.innovationTaxDesc: Meetings, configuration, debugging, technical debt, and non-feature work that drains productivity.
chart.actualCodingDesc: Pure feature development and creative problem-solving - the work that truly matters.

blueprint.title: Define Your Blueprint
blueprint.description: Describe your project with pre-validated modules in a simple YAML file. Choose your stack, integrations, and features. This is the source of truth for your architecture.
blueprint.yamlExample:
# blueprint.yaml
project: MySaaS
architecture:
  - auth: better-auth
  - database: drizzle
  - ui: shadcn-ui
  - api: tRPC
  - deployment: vercel

generation.title: Let the Architect Build
generation.description: Our CLI isn't a black box. It orchestrates a series of clear actions: installing adapters, configuring dependencies, and executing integration blueprints.

code.title: Own 100% of the Code
code.description: The result is clean, modular code that's entirely yours. No hidden dependencies, no vendor lock-in. You have complete control to modify and deploy it wherever you want.

cta.description: Learn more about our architecture approach

define.title: Define Your Stack
define.description: Declare your architecture in a single TypeScript file. Choose your adapters, integrators, and features.

generate.title: Generate Your App
generate.description: Run one command. The Architech orchestrates all integrations automatically.
generate.codeExample:
$ architech generate

✓ Analyzing genome...
✓ Installing modules...
✓ Configuring integrations...
✓ Ready to develop!

customize.title: Customize & Deploy
customize.description: Get production-ready code with 100% ownership. Modify, extend, or eject anytime.
customize.codeExample:
$ architech deploy

✓ Live in 47 seconds
🚀 https://your-app.vercel.app

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.description: Every module is defined by a simple file describing actions: create a file, run a command, add a dependency, etc... It's transparent, easy to debug, and simple to create your own.

blueprint.title: Simple Blueprint File
blueprint.code:
# Blueprint: Authentication Module
version: "1.0"
actions:
  - create_file: "auth.js"
  - run_command: "npm install bcrypt"
  - add_dependency: "express-session"

whereWeFit.subtitle: A New Class of Tool. How The Architech combines the best of every world, without the compromises.

faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about The Architech and how it will transform your development workflow.

whatIsArchitech.question: What is Architech?
whatIsArchitech.answer: Architech is an AI-powered platform that generates complete, production-ready applications from simple text descriptions. It creates full-stack applications with frontend, backend, database, authentication, and deployment configuration.

howDoesItWork.question: How does it work?
howDoesItWork.answer: Simply describe your app idea in plain English, and our AI analyzes your requirements to generate a complete application with all necessary components, following industry best practices and security standards.

whatTechnologies.question: What technologies does it support?
whatTechnologies.answer: Architech supports modern tech stacks including React, TypeScript, Node.js, Express, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and can deploy to platforms like Vercel, AWS, and more.

isItSecure.question: Is the generated code secure?
isItSecure.answer: Yes, all generated applications follow security best practices including JWT authentication, data encryption, input validation, and protection against common vulnerabilities.

canICustomize.question: Can I customize the generated code?
canICustomize.answer: Absolutely! The generated code is fully customizable. You can modify, extend, or refactor any part of the application to meet your specific requirements.

pricing.question: What's the pricing?
pricing.answer: We offer flexible pricing plans for individuals, teams, and enterprises. Contact us to learn more about our pricing options and find the plan that works for you.

vsCreateNextApp.question: How is this different from create-next-app?
vsCreateNextApp.answer: create-next-app gives you a basic Next.js starter. The Architech gives you a production-ready application with authentication, database, payments, and all integrations configured and working together. It's the difference between an empty house and a fully furnished home.

production.question: Can I use this in production?
production.answer: Yes! The Architech generates production-ready code following enterprise-grade best practices. You get TypeScript, ESLint, testing setup, security configurations, and scalable architecture out of the box. No cleanup or refactoring needed.

canIEject.question: Can I eject or is there vendor lock-in?
canIEject.answer: You own 100% of the code. There's no proprietary runtime, no hidden dependencies, no lock-in. The generated code is standard TypeScript/JavaScript that runs anywhere. Modify, extend, or deploy it however you want.

team.subtitle: The Architech is born from real frustration with the current state of development tooling. We're building the platform we wish we had.

story.title: From the Founder
story.paragraph1: After nearly a decade building software and 3 years as CTO across multiple startups, I've watched brilliant ideas die not from lack of vision, but from configuration hell.
story.paragraph2: I've seen teams spend 70% of their time on setup, authentication, deployment pipelines, and database schemas instead of building what makes their product unique. The same solutions, built over and over, with the same bugs, the same security vulnerabilities.
story.paragraph3: The Architech was born from frustration. Why should every developer rebuild authentication? Why should every startup waste months on DevOps? Why isn't there a better way?
story.paragraph4: This isn't just another tool - it's a revolution against complexity. I'm building the platform I wish I had when I was drowning in configuration files at 2 AM, dreaming of focusing on the magic instead of the plumbing.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To give every developer superpowers. To eliminate the tedious setup work that prevents us from building amazing things. To democratize enterprise-grade architecture and make it accessible to everyone.
mission.tagline: Building the future, one module at a time

lightPaper.title: The Architech: The Supply Chain for Modern Software
lightPaper.subtitle: We've optimized every industry but our own. It's time to change that.

digitalParadox.title: 1. The Digital Paradox
digitalParadox.content:
We have an incredible opportunity working in the digital world. A chance the physical industry never had.

In our world, once a product is created, its duplication cost is virtually zero. We can deliver it to millions of people instantly. This is a colossal advantage.

Yet, here is the paradox: while the physical industry spent a century optimizing its production lines for speed, quality, and standardization, the industry building the world of tomorrow—ours, the software industry—still largely operates like a craft workshop.

innovationTax.title: 2. The Digital Artisan and its "Innovation Tax"
innovationTax.content:
Each new project is a reinvention. We choose our tools, assemble our configurations, and write "plumbing" code over and over again. It's slow. It's expensive. It's frustrating.

This is not a feeling. It's a quantifiable reality, an "Innovation Tax" that every project pays. Industry studies confirm it: according to Software.com, developers spend an average of only 52 minutes per day on actual, active coding. Research from Stripe shows that up to 42% of their time is consumed by managing technical debt, often born from a flawed initial setup.

We spend our time as overburdened artisans when we should be visionary architects.

aiMirage.title: 3. The AI Mirage: The Wrong Solution
aiMirage.content:
Faced with this inefficient craftsmanship, we've been sold a silver bullet: Artificial Intelligence. But the AI we are offered today does not solve the structural problem. It merely assists a process that is fundamentally broken.

It's like placing a robot next to a master blacksmith and asking it to imitate his gestures. It ignores history. The real revolution isn't replacing the artisan; it's changing the production line.

Worse, today's AI transforms the exciting role of the developer into a dehumanizing job of verifying and fixing a machine's errors. It steals the joy of design to leave the chore of correction.

softwareSupplyChain.title: 4. The Real Revolution: The Software Supply Chain
softwareSupplyChain.content:
The real problem isn't the tool. It's the method. The real solution is to apply the lessons of the industrial revolution to software development.

This is what we have built. The Architech is the first true "Supply Chain for Software."

Our intelligent orchestrator assembles your application in minutes, following a clear and mastered logic. This is made possible by a new, modular architecture:

adapters.title: The Raw Materials (Adapters)
adapters.description: Each technology (Next.js, Drizzle, Stripe...) is packaged into an Adapter. It's a pure, agnostic, and industrial-grade building block that installs a tool in an isolated and perfect way. No more spending hours searching for the right template.

integrators.title: The Intelligent Components (Integrators)
integrators.description: An Integrator is a smart "bridge" that knows how to connect two or more Adapters. It contains the expert logic to make Drizzle talk to Next.js or to integrate Sentry seamlessly with your authentication, by surgically modifying the code.

assemblyPlant.title: The Assembly Plant (The CLI Engine)
assemblyPlant.description: At the core of the CLI, a sophisticated engine based on an on-demand Virtual File System (VFS) and AST-driven "Modifiers" ensures that every operation is safe, atomic, and predictable. It guarantees the quality of the final product.

softwareSupplyChain.result: The result is not a black box. It is your code—clean, tested, maintainable, based on best practices, and 100% owned by you.

useCases.title: 5. Build Anything, Faster. (Use Cases)
useCases.subtitle: This isn't theoretical. Here is what you can build in minutes, not months.

aiWriting.title: AI Writing Assistant
aiWriting.description: Launch your intelligent content creation platform in a weekend.

ecommerce.title: Modern E-commerce
ecommerce.description: Build a full-featured online store with payments and inventory management.

dashboard.title: Internal Dashboard
dashboard.description: Create powerful analytics and admin tools for your team in minutes.

humanBenefit.title: 6. From Artisan to Architect: The Human Benefit
humanBenefit.content:
What The Architech changes is fundamental. It doesn't just make you faster. It changes your role.

You are no longer the artisan spending your days on thankless tasks. You are no longer the AI's error checker.

You are the Architect. The supervisor. The one who thinks, structures, and innovates. You are elevated to where you always wanted to be. We give you back what brought you to development in the first place: the joy of creation.

founder.title: 7. A Word from the Founder
founder.content:
This mission is deeply personal. It was born from a decade spent in the trenches of development, seeing incredible ideas held back by unnecessary complexity. The Architech is the culmination of that frustration. It's a tool I first built for myself, to recapture that initial creative "spark."

My philosophy is simple: technology should be a lever for emancipation, not a barrier. My goal is to elevate you, to free you from thankless tasks so you can focus on what brought you to development in the first place: the desire to innovate, to think, and to build.

The Architech is the first stone. It is a pragmatic tool to solve a problem of today. But it is built on a foundation—modularity, open standards, and ownership—that prepares for the sovereign Internet of tomorrow.

If this vision of freeing human creativity from useless constraints resonates with you, then join us.

- Antoine

startBuilding.content: The era of frustrating craftsmanship is over. The era of fluid and powerful creation begins now.
